info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 7 at 9:10AM CDT until May 10 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Mud Creek Near Jacksonville affecting Smith, Rusk and Cherokee Counties.
For the Mud Creek...including Jacksonville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mud Creek near Jacksonville.
* WHEN...From this morning to late Friday night.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.6 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 05/07/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 915 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY NIGHT

area.areaDesc: Cherokee, TX; Rusk, TX; Smith, TX
